U. S. House of Representatives
Washington, D. C.
Dear Congressman Staggers:
We should like to respond for the record to several points
which have arisen in connection with testimony on HR 6736.
1. $250,000 LIMIT PER STATION - TITLE II, SECT. 396 (k)
Since the language of the bill appears to include the cost of
interconnection, this would mean that a program grant to a
station or to a regional or national network might well be eaten
up in interconnection cost, whereas the funds ought to go
primarily for program production.
We suggest adding the words "excepting costs of interconnection."
The line would then read: "Notwithstanding the preceding
provisions of this section, no grant or contract pursuant to
this section excepting costs of interconnection may provide
for payment from the appropriation for the period year
ending June 30, 1968, for any one project or to any one station
of more than $250,000.
2. THE 12%% LIMIT ON FACILITIES GRANTS TO STATES - TITLE I, SECT. 102
Does this limitation mean smaller stations will not receive funds
or that some states may be left out?
No. Experience with the 1962 ETV Facilities legislation has shown
that grants have gone to all sizes of stations and in virtually
every state. We are confident that HEW would continue to
discharge its responsibility with due concern for the interests of
all the states, taking into account grants already made to states
